date.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a particular day of the month or year, especially shown by a number
date.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The date on the letter was 30th August 1962.
What’s the date of the next meeting?
You should apply at least 8 weeks before your date of departure.
Have you set a date for the wedding yet?
date.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an occasion when you go out with someone that you like in a romantic way
date.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I felt like a teenager going out on a first date.
I’ve got a date with Andrea tomorrow night.
date.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: someone that you have a date with
date.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Can I bring my date to the party?
date.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a time arranged to meet someone, especially socially
date.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Let’s make a date to come over and visit.
date.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a sweet sticky brown fruit with a long hard seed inside
date.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: I can’t remember the exact date we moved into this house.
The work was not finished by the agreed date.
The closing date for applications is April 30th.
Payment must be made by the due date.
The delivery date should be around 23rd August.
We are aiming at a publication date of mid-November.
My departure date was only a few days away.
Check the expiry date on your credit card.
Those yoghurts are a week past their sell-by date.
Have you decided on a date for the wedding yet?
They haven’t set a date for the election yet.
Don’t forget to put today’s date at the top of the letter.
The insurance will only cover costs incurred on or after the date of departure.
date.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to write or print the date on something
date.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Make sure you sign and date it at the bottom.
date.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to find out when something old was made or formed
date.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The rocks are dated by examining the fossils found in the same layer.
date.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if clothing, art etc dates, it begins to look old-fashioned
date.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: His designs are so classic, they’ve hardly dated at all.
date.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to have a romantic relationship with someone
date.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: if something that you say, do, or wear dates you, it shows that you are fairly old
date.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: Yes, I remember the Moon landings – that dates me, doesn’t it?
date.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: the words you use to talk about a particular day, month, and year
date.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The date on the letter was 30 June 2006.
date.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: the words written on a BILL OF EXCHANGE to show that the bill can be paid a particular period of time after the date on the bill
date.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to write the date on a letter or cheque
date.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: In a letter dated 1st August 1999, the inspector said he would need to examine the company’s accounts.
